claim: The 2012 consumption gap between CZK- and EUR-paying customers represented roughly 15% of total national fuel imports into the Czech Republic that year.
extra_info: Year 2012 can be presented as Between 201201 And 201212; The first 4 strings of the Date values in the yearmonth table can represent year; Difference in Consumption = CZK customers consumption in 2012 - EUR customers consumption in 2012
reasoning: The claim references 'total national fuel imports into the Czech Republic,' which is a macroeconomic/trade statistic not present anywhere in the database. The database only contains individual customer consumption data, gas station information, and transaction records. There is no table or column containing national fuel import data, making it impossible to verify whether the consumption gap represents 15% of national fuel imports. This is an OUT-OF-SCHEMA claim.

content.text:
I need to analyze this claim carefully before querying the database.

The claim states: "The 2012 consumption gap between CZK- and EUR-paying customers represented roughly 15% of total national fuel imports into the Czech Republic that year."

This claim references "total national fuel imports into the Czech Republic" — this is a macroeconomic/trade statistic. Let me check if the database contains such information.

input.description: List all tables in the database

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/debit_card_specializing.sqlite" ".schema customers" && sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/debit_card_specializing.sqlite" ".schema yearmonth" && sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/debit_card_specializing.sqlite" ".schema gasstations" && sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/debit_card_specializing.sqlite" ".schema products" && sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/debit_card_specializing.sqlite" ".schema transactions_1k"

content.content:
CREATE TABLE customers
(
    CustomerID INTEGER UNIQUE     not null
        primary key,
    Segment    TEXT null,
    Currency   TEXT null
);
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "yearmonth"
(
    CustomerID  INTEGER not null
        references customers
            on update cascade on delete cascade
        references customers,
    Date        TEXT    not null,
    Consumption REAL,
    primary key (Date, CustomerID)
);
CREATE TABLE gasstations
(
    GasStationID INTEGER    UNIQUE   not null
        primary key,
    ChainID      INTEGER          null,
    Country      TEXT null,
    Segment      TEXT null
);
CREATE TABLE products
(
    ProductID   INTEGER   UNIQUE      not null
        primary key,
    Description TEXT null
);
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "transactions_1k"
(
    TransactionID INTEGER
        primary key autoincrement,
    Date          DATE,
    Time          TEXT,
    CustomerID    INTEGER,
    CardID        INTEGER,
    GasStationID  INTEGER,
    ProductID     INTEGER,
    Amount        INTEGER,
    Price         REAL
);

tool_use_result.stdout:
CREATE TABLE customers
(
    CustomerID INTEGER UNIQUE     not null
        primary key,
    Segment    TEXT null,
    Currency   TEXT null
);
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "yearmonth"
(
    CustomerID  INTEGER not null
        references customers
            on update cascade on delete cascade
        references customers,
    Date        TEXT    not null,
    Consumption REAL,
    primary key (Date, CustomerID)
);
CREATE TABLE gasstations
(
    GasStationID INTEGER    UNIQUE   not null
        primary key,
    ChainID      INTEGER          null,
    Country      TEXT null,
    Segment      TEXT null
);
CREATE TABLE products
(
    ProductID   INTEGER   UNIQUE      not null
        primary key,
    Description TEXT null
);
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "transactions_1k"
(
    TransactionID INTEGER
        primary key autoincrement,
    Date          DATE,
    Time          TEXT,
    CustomerID    INTEGER,
    CardID        INTEGER,
    GasStationID  INTEGER,
    ProductID     INTEGER,
    Amount        INTEGER,
    Price         REAL
);

content.text:
The database contains information about customer consumption, gas stations, transactions, and products. It tracks consumption by customer (with currency CZK or EUR) over time.

The claim asserts that the consumption gap between CZK and EUR customers "represented roughly 15% of total national fuel imports into the Czech Republic that year." The database has no information about **total national fuel imports into the Czech Republic**. This is an external macroeconomic statistic that is completely outside the scope of this database, which only tracks individual customer consumption at gas stations.

This is a classic **OUT-OF-SCHEMA** case — the claim references a concept ("total national fuel imports into the Czech Republic") that does not exist anywhere in the database schema.

```json
{"label": "NOT ENOUGH INFO", "reasoning": "The claim references 'total national fuel imports into the Czech Republic,' which is a macroeconomic/trade statistic not present anywhere in the database. The database only contains individual customer consumption data, gas station information, and transaction records. There is no table or column containing national fuel import data, making it impossible to verify whether the consumption gap represents 15% of national fuel imports. This is an OUT-OF-SCHEMA claim."}
```
